p.seg: Yan Yuan asked Confucius:
“May I ask
if there is a method in the way the gentleman deals with the “internal affairs”?
Confucius said:
“There is.”
Yan Yuan:
“May I ask what should be done?”
Confucius said:
“Being softly (?) indulgent with minor mistakes
and setting an example to the officers,
treating the old as old and being kind with the young,
lowering taxes (?) and giving to the poor,
asking for more when the emoluments are not enough,
and declining when there is leftover (?).
“Being softly (?) indulgent with minor mistakes
is the way to provide relief;
setting an example to the officers
is the way to obtain (the right) emotions (?);
treating the old as old and being kind with the young,
is the way to establish humanity;
lowering taxes (?) and giving to the poor
is the way to obtain close relationships;
asking for more when the emoluments are not enough,
and declining when there is leftover (?),
is the way to be raise trust.
So the way the gentleman deals with the “internal affairs”
is like this.
Yan Yuan said:
“As for the way the gentleman deals with the “internal affairs,
I, Hui, have heard your order (?).
May I dare asking
if there is a method in the way the gentleman deals with internal education?”
Confucius said:
“There is”.
Yan Yuan:
May I ask what should be done?
Confucius said:
“If one takes the lead in cultivating himself,
then nobody among the people will not follow;
if one is first in extending love,
then nobody among the people will not come close;
if one leads them in thriftiness,
then the people will know when it is enough (?),
if one is first among them in conceding,
then the people will not fight (among themselves).”
Moreover if one teaches them by leading them,
empowers the talented,
despises the unworthy and takes them at bay,
then the people will know prohibitions.
If the ones advancing (?) will be encouraged to move forwards,
the ones retreating will know prohibitions [positive measures for the good, negative checks for the wicked],
then his attitude towards teaching
will not be far off the mark.”
Yan Yuan said:
‘As for the attitude of the gentleman towards the inner teachings,
I, Hui, have now heard about it,
may I ask about achieving fame?”
Confucius said:
“When virtue is established then fame is achieved,
when fame is achieved one must humble oneself,
when one has disciplined oneself then there will be great emoluments.”
[The gentleman concedes] and thereby obtains things,
the petty person fights and loses them.”
and does not wish to obtain. (?)
